intro: Xyridion monnieri, commonly known as the narrowleaf waterflag, is a herbaceous wetland plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, producing tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are wind-pollinated. Xyridion monnieri plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
